data.title: Saving a file inside .vscode folder toggles off the rendering of whitespace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ensure whitespace is not being shown
2. Click View -> Toggle Render Whitespace
3. Observe that whitespace is being shown
4. Save the file
5. Observe that whitespace is no longer being shown

Saving the file should not toggle off the rendering of whitespace.

Open a json file and hover on any property. Following is seen in console from JSON Language server

[Error - 9:28:02 AM] Request textDocument/hover failed.

data.title: Multiple „Do you want to save changes… ?“ dialogs
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (ced1d697f81499df60b00d3a02ab264e5e0c99e4, 2016-11-25T07:05:03.920Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.5.5|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.7|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|vscode-csscomb|mrmlnc|3.2.4|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.0.1|
|vscode-nginx|shanoor|0.3.0|
|language-stylus|sysoev|1.6.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open/create file in VSCode
2. Change file (so its status become unsaved)
3. Press `Cmd+W` multiple times to close file (I want to close open files sequentially)
4. When „Do you want to save changes… ?“ dialog appears, press `Esc` to get rid of it (say, you changed your mind, and do not want to close it anymore)

Expected behavior:

„Do you want to save changes… ?“ dialogs dissapears and editor is available for editing again.

Actual behavior:

„Do you want to save changes… ?“ dialog for changed file is shown as many times as `Cmd+W` was presed.

data.title: Wildcard support for `onCommand` in `activationEvents` config

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan

It would be nice to have wildcards support for `onCommand:` in `activationEvents` configuration. Currently most (all?) extension's command contributions have to be duplicated in the `activationEvents` section (and managed accordingly when commands are added/removed).

For example, if I understand correctly, [all these lines here](https://github.com/DonJayamanne/pythonVSCode/blob/1f2f3f854031c8193a79b7e31dc47cbd4ac8ab86/package.json#L45-L55) could be replaced with single `onCommand:python.*`

Maybe related to #944.

data.title: Split settings into two file!

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (fd4d938088d3ee94810daaa07ba9a234ecf89ca9, 2016-11-24T07:59:54.010Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.3.0

In current , we have `common settings` and `ui settings` in one file. As time going, this file becoming  more and more mass and bloated. And it's hard to find a setting item in it.
So i suggest split this file into `common` and `ui` setting.
While the `common` setting hold `editor` and `workbench` and `common` setting, and the `ui` setting hold those setting which can take effect on vsc's looks.

data.title: [ERROR]: C# Extension failed to install the debugger package
data.body:

1. Install c# extension , by click install .
2. Click reload.

I tried the same steps more than once , and the result ,

Thank You

data.title: Dedupe identical suggestions
data.body:
Hello, VS Code team!

/cc @aeschli — because he's God of the CSS service in VS Code
/cc @Tyriar — because I know that he uses the `vscode-scss` and may regard the proposal as a user
/cc any VS Code team members and users

I am the creator of two very useful (😅) plugins: [vscode-less](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mrmlnc.vscode-less) and [vscode-scss](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mrmlnc.vscode-scss).

These plugins provide more informative suggestions for Less and Sass symbols (such as Variables, Mixins and Functions) from all files in the workspace (including `@import` and `// <reference...>` comments).

And it would be nice if users could **disable the standard suggestions** for Symbols because they have duplicates.

For example, Variables in Less:

![photoshop_2016-11-24_23-57-31](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/20609941/c3e7dbc6-b2a3-11e6-94d7-4bfc8e89133d.png)

And Functions in Sass:

![code - insiders_2016-11-25_00-03-30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7034281/20609943/d0146bee-b2a3-11e6-9562-3373b81f0aad.png)

**For users**. Please, use GitHub emotions:

👍 - upvote
👎 - downvote

data.title: Customize Codelens Font
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
1.7.2
- OS Version:
Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

The actual implementation of Codelens on VSCode is annoying. I did a research, and I can disable Codelens with "editor.codeLens": false. 

But I think will be good if, instead of full disable, I can customize the font size. If the codelens have at least on half of the current size, maybe it can be usable... With the current size, it looks with an actual line of code. So, maybe you can do some options like:
"editor.codeLens.fontFamily": "Consolas, 'Courier New', monospace",
"editor.codeLens.fontWeight": "normal",
"editor.codeLens.fontSize": 7,

data.title: Editor problems with latin symbols
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (6a6ab1fc5e58227b56ffc3e5bea9951e5565c314, 2016-11-24T07:05:02.837Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|1.1.3|
|jsx|TwentyChung|0.0.1|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.0|
|stylus|buzinas|0.1.0|
|riot-tag|crisward|0.1.7|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.0|
|tslint|eg2|0.6.4|
|rest-client|humao|0.10.5|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.2.2|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.2.1|
|jadeview|vivainio|1.0.0|
|vscode-react-native|vsmobile|0.2.3|
|ReactSnippets|xabikos|1.2.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. type any accented latin symbol `í`
2. press space

They will appear twice: `íí`

Also when typing ` character and space, two of them appear but the cursor is positioning at the end of both, not in between, so you end up writting 

```
``some text
```

instead of 


```
`some text`
```

data.title: Stop auto fetching if authentication fails repeatedly

data.body: From Microsoft/vscode#15943

data.title: [Question] File explorer jumps when closing files
data.body:
This is very annoying UX.

If you are editing a file and then you close it, then the editor focus on another file (obviously).

But when this happens, the File Explorer jumps to that file!

This is very very disturbing because if I want to edit 2 files from the top of my File Explorer, this happens:

1. Scroll tree view to top (to find my first file)
2. Edit it, close file.
3. Editor moves my tree view again to the bottom! <--- This shouldn't happen!
4. Scroll AGAIN tree view to top (to find my second file) <--- This shouldn't happen!
5. Edit it, close file.

It is possible to change this? how?

data.body: I'd like to know how I can automatically run `nvm use` when I open the terminal or a new tab. Is it already doable? Or is it something that could get implemented.

data.title: JavaScript syntax highlighting not used for inline script in HTML files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607 (OS Build 14393.0)
- Color Theme: Light (Visual Studio)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an HTML page that contains some inline JavaScript (example below) in a ```<script>``` tag.
2. View the HTML in Visual Studio Code.

The inline JavaScript is shown using colorization that does not match the colorization used for JavaScript files. JavaScript should be rendered in the same colours in the editor consistently.

**Example HTML**
```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>An HTML Page</title>
</head>
<body>
    <script>
        console.log("This is some inline JavaScript");
    </script>
</body>
</html>
```

**Expected appearance**
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1439341/20604256/67d665fa-b25d-11e6-9eea-a30a1f59175d.png)

**Actual appearance**
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1439341/20604234/45a8fba0-b25d-11e6-83e1-cc20f89f922e.png)

data.title: Faster startup/improve startup time
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. start VSCode from explorer with a simple 5 kb xml. Only python plugin installed.

Startup duration about 4 seconds on an i5 with SSD and 12 GB memory.

Competing editor sublime text 3 needs less than 1 second (including directly visible syntax highlighting)

Would be great, if startup time could be improved, too. (but without leaving it running in the background)

data.title: Test: compounds in launch.json
data.body:
- [x] any os @joaomoreno 
- [x] any os @sandy081 

Complexity: 3

As described in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14842 we now support launching multiple debug sessions at once using`"compounds" `in 'launch.json'.
Have a workspace to debug (e.g our smoke test) open 'launch.json' and verify:
* You get nice suggestions / snippets when trying to add a new compound in your 'launch.json'
* Starting a compound starts the specified configurations at the same time

No need to test multi target debugging in great details as this is covered in #15305. This item is more about the "compound" experience.

data.title: VS Code shortcut is forgotten after an update

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set VS Code shortcut key (e.g. open VS Code on given shortcut)
2. Update VS Code
3. Reboot
4. Open VS Code with saved shortcut

IMO updates remove all saved options (such as "Run as administrator"). This is not critical, but... it is annoying to setup on each update.
